meanings.definition: A state of nervousness or agitation.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside caused a sudden case of swivets in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: She felt the swivets creeping in as she waited for her exam results.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unexpected meow startled him, sending him into a fit of swivets.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful movie had him on swivets throughout, unsure of what would happen next.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley filled him with swivets, imagining all sorts of scary scenarios.

meanings.sent1: He started to swivets when he realized he was lost in the unfamiliar neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The children began to swivets as the storm grew stronger outside.
meanings.sent3: She tends to swivets before giving presentations, but always does a great job.
meanings.sent4: The news of the upcoming test made him swivets about his preparation.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected visitor made the dog swivets, barking loudly to alert the family.
